alert.note: Alert for Bell; Bosque; Comanche; Coryell; Falls; Hamilton; Lampasas; McLennan; Milam; Mills (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 12 at 1:41AM CDT until May 12 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: .Heavy rainfall may result in flooding across portions of Central Texas beginning this evening and continuing through the day Sunday. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central Texas and south central Texas, including the following counties, in north central Texas, Bell, Bosque, Comanche, Coryell, Falls, Hamilton, Lampasas, McLennan and Mills. In south central Texas, Milam. * WHEN...From this evening through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in urban and poor-drainage areas. Heavy rainfall could also cause flooding of creeks, streams, and rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall totals of 2 to 4 inches, with isolated higher amounts in excess of 5 inches possible.
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead to flooding which can be a very dangerous situation. You should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should a warning be issued. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding and flash flooding.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Bosque; Comanche; Coryell; Falls; Hamilton; Lampasas; McLennan; Milam; Mills
